revised_title: Direct and Relayed Periodontal Afferent Projections to the Cerebellum in Ferrets
tldr: This study investigates the direct and relayed projection of periodontal receptor afferents to the cerebellum in ferrets. The research found that there are both direct and relayed inputs from periodontal receptors via mossy fibers in a specific region of the cerebellar cortex. These findings provide insights into the complex interactions between sensory inflow and motor commands in the cerebellum.
